$comment: Schema for a list of argument mining papers, unique by paper_id and doi

paper_id.$comment: Unique id, should be human readable

open_alex_id.$comment: Unique open alex id if available

paper_link.$comment: URL where paper can be accessed

annotations.$comment: Schema for a list of annotation tasks carried out on an argument mining corpora, unique

corpus_id.$comment: Unique id for the corpus being annotated, should be human readable

annotation_task.$comment: Array of annotation tasks performed on the corpora

items.$comment: Type of annotation task performed, Argument Component Segmentation (ACS), Argument Component Type Classification (ACTC), Claim Evidence Extraction (CE), Claim Evidence Pair Extraction (CEPE), Aspect-Based Argument Mining (ABAM), Context-Dependent Claim Detection (CDCD), Context-Dependent Evidence Detection (CDED), Claim Extraction with Stance Classification (CESC), Argumentative Relation Identification (ARI), Argumentative Relation Type Classification (ARTC), ? (ACRE), and Other for anything else
Paragraph of description. If you start a string with NOTE it will be highlighted in the display.

annotator_type.$comment: Type of annotators involved in the annotation task, Author (the authors of the paper), Expert (domain experts), Student (students, e.g. undergraduates), Crowd (crowdsourced workers, e.g. from MTurk or Prolific), Other (anything else)

agreement_type.$comment: Type of inter-annotator agreement measure used, Cohen's Kappa, Fleiss' Kappa, Krippendorff's Alpha, Percent Agreement, Other (anything else)

agreement_score.$comment: Inter-annotator agreement score, percentages should be represented as a decimal. If a non-exact value is reported, specify in the deviant_agreement_type field how to interpret this value, you can then either report a range, or a ? for missing values, or a single value for averages. Optionally, if multiple scores are reported for different labels you can report them as an object, with the label names as keys and the scores as values.

accessibility.$comment: Accessibility of the annotated data, Free (freely available online), Upon Request (available from authors upon request), Paid (available for a fee), Unavailable (not available)

corpus_link.$comment: URL where the annotated data can be accessed, if available. If not available, link to the paper describing the annotation task

corpus_name.$comment: Name given to corpus by authors. If not specified then the corpus name will be inferred from corpus_id.

subset.$comment: Subset of main corpus annotated in this task
